Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Interface UserInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CLI, Gui
    public interface UserInterface

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void askGrenade()
      When a user takes damage from another player, it will be asked if he wants to use this powerUp
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> askMapAndSkulls()
      Ask mapType and number of skulls to place in the killshotTrack (only to the first player connected)
      void close()
      Close the UserInterface, after a timer of the current action phase expires
      void doFrenzyAtomicShoot()
      This method will ask the player to redo just the shoot part of the FrenzyShoot
      void doFrenzyReload()
      This method will ask the player to do the reload atomic action for the frenzy shoot
      void endGame()
      This method will show the end game screen
      void gameSelection()  
      void login()
      Method that handles the player login
      void notifyUpdate​(UpdateType updateType, int playerId, TurnUpdate turnUpdate)
      Notify that a local client class has been updated inside the cachemodel
      void retryLogin​(java.lang.Exception e)
      Same as above, but with custom exceptions instead of String as error
      void retryLogin​(java.lang.String error)
      If the above method throws an error, it shows the error and let the user retry to login
      void setValidMove​(boolean b)
      Method useful for movements.
      void show​(java.lang.String s)
      Show a message on the user interface
      void startAction​(boolean isFrenzy, boolean isBeforeFrenzyStarter)
      StartAction method, in which the user can choose between the game actions: move, move grab, shoot
      void startGame()
      Start the game in the selected user interface
      void startPowerUp()
      Handles the user powerUp phase, in which it let the user choose if he wants to use a PowerUp or skip this phase
      void startReload()
      Last turn phase, in which the user is asked if he wants to reload one or more of his weapons
      void startSpawn()
      Handles the user spawn, asking for a powerUp to discard and forwarding it to the view linked to this UI
      void startUI()
      This function starts the ui and ask the user which protocol wants to use

    • Method Detail

      • startUI

        void startUI()
        This function starts the ui and ask the user which protocol wants to use

      • askMapAndSkulls

        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> askMapAndSkulls()
        Ask mapType and number of skulls to place in the killshotTrack (only to the first player connected)
        Returns:
        a list of 2 integers, the first one is the chosen mapType, the second one the chosen number of skulls

      • show

        void show​(java.lang.String s)
        Show a message on the user interface
        Parameters:
        s - string to show

      • close

        void close()
        Close the UserInterface, after a timer of the current action phase expires

      • notifyUpdate

        void notifyUpdate​(UpdateType updateType,
                  int playerId,
                  TurnUpdate turnUpdate)
        Notify that a local client class has been updated inside the cachemodel
        Parameters:
        updateType - the class which has been updated
        playerId - useful in some case to determine which player has been updated (i.e. new position)
        turnUpdate - is the update class if the update is of type Turn

      • startGame

        void startGame()
        Start the game in the selected user interface

      • setValidMove

        void setValidMove​(boolean b)
        Method useful for movements. First the client calls askMoveValid, with a single direction, the the server reply back to the client throught this setter, and it sets validMove to true if the direction is valid (no walls, nor out of map), otherwise false
        Parameters:
        b - boolean, true if direction is valid, false otherwise

      • gameSelection

        void gameSelection()

      • login

        void login()
        Method that handles the player login

      • retryLogin

        void retryLogin​(java.lang.String error)
        If the above method throws an error, it shows the error and let the user retry to login
        Parameters:
        error -

      • retryLogin

        void retryLogin​(java.lang.Exception e)
        Same as above, but with custom exceptions instead of String as error
        Parameters:
        e - custom exception to represent why login wasn't successful

      • startSpawn

        void startSpawn()
        Handles the user spawn, asking for a powerUp to discard and forwarding it to the view linked to this UI

      • startPowerUp

        void startPowerUp()
        Handles the user powerUp phase, in which it let the user choose if he wants to use a PowerUp or skip this phase

      • askGrenade

        void askGrenade()
        When a user takes damage from another player, it will be asked if he wants to use this powerUp

      • startAction

        void startAction​(boolean isFrenzy,
                 boolean isBeforeFrenzyStarter)
        StartAction method, in which the user can choose between the game actions: move, move grab, shoot
        Parameters:
        isFrenzy - if is set to true start Frenzy methods, otherwise normal actions
        isBeforeFrenzyStarter - if true: current player is before frenzy starter, otherwise false

      • doFrenzyAtomicShoot

        void doFrenzyAtomicShoot()
        This method will ask the player to redo just the shoot part of the FrenzyShoot

      • doFrenzyReload

        void doFrenzyReload()
        This method will ask the player to do the reload atomic action for the frenzy shoot

      • startReload

        void startReload()
        Last turn phase, in which the user is asked if he wants to reload one or more of his weapons

      • endGame

        void endGame()
        This method will show the end game screen
